question: At which among the following places, the Muslim League was founded in 1906?
explanation: All India Muslim League was founded in 1906 by Khwaja Salimullah, Vikar-ul-Mulk, Syed Amir Ali, Syed Nabiullah, Khan Bahadur Ghulam , Mustafa Chowdhury, Sir Sultan Muhammad Shah (Aga Khan III) etc. The League supported the Partition of Bengal and opposed the Swadeshi Movement and demanded the special safeguards for its community and separate electorate of Muslims.
